results.title: Days of Stargazey Pie
results.creator_credit: Margaret Haselgrove, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Australia. Office of Multicultural Affairs
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Cornish descendants, a tourist guide and a historian talk about the contribution that the Cornish miners made to the development of the South Australian copper mines at Burra and Moonta. We also look at some of their traditions which have been handed down from generation to generation in this ‘Little Cornwall”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Margaret Haselgrove, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Australia. Office of Multicultural Affairs

results.title: Threads of Ireland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
This program looks at the traditions and culture brought to Australia by the Irish Catholic convicts, and the way in which the Irish influence is still present in modern Australia. Explores the history of Australian writing, music and religion which have an Irish influence.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
This program looks at the traditions and culture brought to Australia by the Irish Catholic convicts, and the way in which the Irish influence is still present in modern Australia. Explores the history of Australian writing, music and religion which have an Irish influence.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
This program looks at the traditions and culture brought to Australia by the Irish Catholic convicts, and the way in which the Irish influence is still present in modern Australia. Explores the history of Australian writing, music and religion which have an Irish influence.

results.title: The Story of steel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Industry Series No. 1”.
The story of the manufacture of steel, from the mining of the three raw materials, through the refining process, to the finished product in the rolling mill.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Australian Industry Series No. 1”.
The story of the manufacture of steel, from the mining of the three raw materials, through the refining process, to the finished product in the rolling mill.

results.title: Beechworth [B&W]
results.creator_credit: National Trust, John Kingsford-Smith and Ampol Petroleum Ltd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Heritage”.
Historic buildings of the former gold mining town of Beechworth, Vic., including the gold office, prison, powder magazine, churches and the Court House where Ned Kelly was tried three times.

results.title: La Trobe Cottage [B&W]
results.creator_credit: National Trust, John Kingsford-Smith, Ampol Petroleum Ltd and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Heritage”.
A look at La Trobe Cottage, Victoria’s first Government House. Brought out from England, it was assembled on a foundation of hand-make bricks.

results.title: Urban patterns
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Geography”
A study of the pattern of settlement in Australia, showing how the primacy of the major cities developed and how the economy continues to reinforce their dominance. For schools.
